name: Hampton Inn and Suites Islamorada

reviews.text: I just stayed one night, Dec 9th for business. Everything about my stay was great. I didn't make it to check into the hotel until 1:30 am. Even though it was that late, they were still expecting me. The young lady was very courteous at check in, and even managed a nice conversation even though it was very late. I was given an ocean view room (which is what my reservation was for) on the 5th floor (top floor). The room was very large, complete with a kitchen, couch, chair, dining table, and a separate bedroom. The room as well as the bathroom was very clean. The bed was comfortable. The view from the room was outstanding; less than 20 yards to the water. I will be staying here again the next time I'm in the Keys.
reviews.title: Great Keys Hotel

reviews.text: I am writing this because I was nervous about our stay after reading the "black mold" review. I had been really excited and all of the reviews prior to this fall had been extremely positive.
reviews.title: We are here now & don't want to leave!!!

reviews.text: We have had no problems at all. I have not seen any mold. Even if I did see a little bit of it I wouldn't be too upset because it is so damp here all the time. However, the hotel is clean, does not smell in the rooms. The only complaint I have is that the hallway on our floor (4th) stinks like smoke badly. Inside of our room there is a separate ventilation system and there is no smell of smoke at all. I hate cigarette smoke and would be the first to complain if it did smell in here.
reviews.title: Going downhill fast

reviews.text: With all of that said, we are here now with our two children and we do not want to leave. The pool is a nice size and very warm. The hammocks are so peaceful to drink your morning coffee on or lay and watch the stars at night.
reviews.title: Another day in Paradise

likes.disliked: — Staff could havce been friendlier and more responsive

reviews.text: Oh, try not to eat at the Outback if you don't have to, they are rude and the food is awful. Go down the street to Wallyhoo's, AWESOME!!!!
reviews.title: Beware: Worst hotel I have ever experienced!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a well-located hotel that provides all the amenities needed for a comfortable, enjoyable Florida Keys vacation home base. The rooms and suites are very spacious, there's a complimentary, well-stocked continental breakfast (with great coffee) every morning, and an Outback restaurant attached if you don't want to experiment with local eateries. The pool area is clean and well-maintained with lots of chaise lounges and umbrellas and part of this area is a tiki bar with cocktails and bar foods available. The hotel is oceanfront but there's no swimmable beach - there are though lots of chaise lounges and hammocks in the sand here for relaxing and enjoying the lovely ocean views. There's a nice gift shop in the hotel and they can arrange snorkeling trips and kayak/boat rentals for you.
reviews.title: Great place for families

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There are nice beach areas within easy driving distance - we liked Sombrero Beach which is about 30-40 minutes west in Marathon - the drive there was fast-moving and VERY scenic. There are other nice, smaller beach areas closer to the hotel if driving a 1/2 hour doesn't interest you.
reviews.title: Great three night vacation here

reviews.text: I spent many hours researching Islamorada hotels online , have never written a review before but was so happy with the outcome that I wanted to share the info.. We were so pleased with everything about the Hampton Inn. The pool area and beach are so tropical- well maintained and so relaxing. Tikki hut is convenient and you can get food from Outback there.
reviews.title: Had A Great Stay at the Islamorada Hampton Inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were upgraded to 2 bedrm suite which was huge(2 bbdrm- 2 ba, kitchen,LV) and friends had spacious standard room. We were all thrilled with accomodations and the staff was so helpful. Only suggestion would be if you can upgrade or spend a little more money the pool side of resort is quieter. From time to time we could hear cars in parking lot. For the money and lack of resort fee felt that we got a great deal and would go back in a minute.
reviews.title: Very nice indeed!

likes.liked: — Outback outdoor bar with live, local, music

reviews.text: Husbands fished at Bud and Mary's marina and ate their catch next door at Lazy Days which are both just steps away..Try the lazy day topping!. Best sunset was at IslamoradaFish Co. Memorable trip.
reviews.title: Good value in very nice beachfront hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were in Room 316 and were booked for 2 nights but checked out after one night there.
reviews.title: Needs an Update

reviews.text: GOOD:
reviews.title: Phyllis and others, you are the best!

reviews.text: The 2 room suite was huge and overlooked the ocean and "beach"
reviews.title: Value is a Relative Thing, Apparently

reviews.text: The kitchen in the room was full sized
reviews.title: A Nice Roadside Oasis!

reviews.text: Free breakfast was very nice in a tropical setting
reviews.title: Nice place, great staff!

reviews.text: Hilton has a reputation for having great hotels, well sad for this one because it should not have the badge of Hampton inn. From the beginning, when you come into to the hotel things look ok but once you hit the room there goes everything. For starters I was with a party of four reservations and every single room had something wrong with it. One the fridge did not work and leaked all the time, another room one of the stoves did not work and part of the frame for the sliding window was falling apart. The third one being a suite the pull out sofa was damage, and was very hard to pull out. The fourth one, water was coming in since one of the days it rained with wind. All of the rooms we were told that had queens for beds, which when you came into the room you noticed that these beds were a little small to be a queen. And make sure you don’t make a person taller than 5,6 sleep in the pull out bed because he wont fit in it. All furniture in the rooms are outdated and lack the charisma of Hilton hotels. These rooms need a lot of maintance, all of the rooms that I saw needed to be painted or had some wall damage. The suite are not that big of a deal since the only thing they have extra is a stove, fridge and a wall to separate the room from the pull out sofa. We had a one room suite which we had to change on the last day because of severe water flooding from our room to the one below, and then to the extend they give us a smoking 2 bedroom suite. Wow, a 2 bedroom suite but im a non-smoker and I have asthma so Imagine what happened that last day. Pool is nice and the area in the back is relaxing and by the way there is no beach in this hotel only a sea wall with a ladder leading to the sea, with rocks, big rocks. Some of the staffs were of great help, but not all of them. I had planned for a couple of days of relaxation but did not get at all. Hopefully this will help someone to make a better judgement.
reviews.title: A little gateway to HELL

likes.liked: — Had a outback next to the hotel

reviews.text: We booked a 2-bedroom suite at this Hampton Inn & Suites in Islamorada and were pleasently surpised. The suite was clean, roomy and comfortable. Our suite [on the 5th floor] was not ocean-front, but you could easily see the ocean from the balcony.
reviews.title: Pleasant Stay

likes.liked: — Convinient location, nice pool & hammock area, large suite, cleanliness
likes.disliked: — Beds were a little too firm.

reviews.text: Having a kitchen in the room is a big plus for some folk, but I found ours a bit cramped -- though it was adequately supplied and also clean. The beds were a bit too firm and the sheets were a little stiff for my taste -- but all in all, it is a GREAT value for the price!
reviews.title: Terrible Room, Wonderful View

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff was helpful, the breakfast was good, the pool/tiki area was nice and the hammocks by sandy area next to the dock were simply delightful. Even the gift shop has some cute outfits at very reasonable prices!
reviews.title: Nice pool and Tiki Bar

reviews.text: The hotel's location is ideal. It was an easy 45 minute drive to Bahia Honda and there are two great restaurants just down the road: Lazy Days & Morada Bay Cafe.
reviews.title: Where's the Keys Relaxed Attitude?

likes.disliked: — Unfriendly management, not accomidating to boaters,

aka: Hampton Inn And Suites Islamorada Hotel
